title: Dorset & Hampshire Live - 30 September - BBC News
summary: unexploded world war ii bomb in portsmouth harbour blown up .
southampton assistant manager eric black named in corruption claims .
the public consultation into merging all nine dorset councils has reached halfway .
saints take a point after draw with hapoel be'er sheva .
weather : sunny spells and scattered showers . high of 18°c .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for joining us.. we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday .
you can keep up with the news on our hampshire & isle of wight and dorset indexes over the weekend .

documents.title: breakingnew statement from southampton fc on eric black
text: southampton fc have issue a new statement following allegations in the daily telegraph about assistant manager , eric black .
the full statement can be read on the club 's website in which it says :
the club continues to take any situation relating to our employees very seriously , and we will undertake a full internal review , working closely with the fa and the premier league .
we would like to place on record that eric remains an employee of southampton football club and , like any other employee here , will be afforded respect and support in this matter .

it goes on to say that `` southampton football club is totally committed to the strong values and culture that our fans and staff share , and will continue to provide full support to any initiative that improves the game we love and treasure . ''

documents.title: leicester v southampton team news
text: southampton boss claude puel is likely to recall several players for sunday 's premier league clash at leicester .
charlie austin , jose fonte , steven davis and ryan bertrand are among those expected to be recalled after being rested for the europa league game in midweek .
leicester midfielder nampalys mendy could return after a month out with an ankle injury .

documents.title: carers group closure : 'it was a very hard decision '
text: the founder of a carers group has spoken of her hard decision in closing its dorchester branch after she was involved in an accident .
enid evans set up carers moving forward but she says she is no longer able to travel to the town .

documents.title: watford v bournemouth team news
text: bournemouth travel to watford on saturday .
cherries ' joshua king is still nursing a hamstring injury but has been in light training this week .
marc pugh faces further time on the sidelines with a similar problem but adam smith is fit despite taking a knock to the face last weekend .
watford defenders craig cathcart and miguel britos are both doubful with groin injuries .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: jewellery worth £ 77,000 stolen in southampton burglary
text: jewellery worth an estimated £ 77,000 , along with £ 23,000 in cash has been stolen from a house in southampton .
thieves broke in to the house on glenwood avenue though a window on sunday evening .
rings , necklaces , bracelets and a gold rolex watch were taken .
police have appealed for information from anyone seen acting sus in the area .
this has obviously been a very distressing time for the family involved as many of the items not only held great monetary value but also huge sentimental value . ''

documents.title: by-election in weymouth
text: voters living in weymouth 's wey valley ward will be asked to go to the polls on 27 october 2016 to elect a new borough councillor .
the election is taking place following the resignation of councillor cory russell .

documents.title: raynes park disruption resolved
text: you can hear the show on iplayer .
the wall of sound with @ twitterid is live on southsea seafront in our mobile # tikitikitiki caravan from 1947 !

documents.title: gravel hill works 'half way through '
text: contractors have reached the half-way stage of improvement works at gravel hill in poole .

the £ 3.9m roadworks have so far involved the removal of traffic lights and islands from the queen anne drive junction , vegetation clearance , tree felling , relocation of utility pipes and cables and the construction of a retaining wall .
metal piles have been driven in to the ground and soil nails have been installed to support the edge of a new footpath and cycle lane .
although some works may continue up until the end of january we are currently on schedule to re-open the road by the end of november .
we would like to thank everyone for their patience during these works . ''

documents.title: mystery jets : 'growing old gracefully is overrated '
text: blaine harrison , lead singer of the southseafest headliners mystery jets , says he is n't ready to grow up yet .

documents.title: attempted break-in at student house
text: students are being warned to secure their homes after an attempted burglary at a student house in southampton .
a bay window was forced and damaged at a house in belmont road yesterday evening but it is not believed that anything was stolen .
this incident occurred in a small time frame within a busy residential street .
there is a possibility the person or persons responsible were disturbed , so may not have entered the house .
i would like to advise members of the public to ensure all windows and doors are completely shut and locked when leaving the house .

documents.title: cats left on new forest roadside rescued by rspca
text: two cats left by the side of the road in the new forest have been rescued by the rspca .
the cats were found by cyclists dumped in pet carriers in burley .
photos : cats in cages left dumped on hampshire roadside

documents.title: dorset councils merger plan survey 'is representative '
text: a less than 1 % response to a survey on the future of local government in dorset has been defended by the county council leader .
authorities are considering four options including reducing the number of councils in the county from nine to two from 2019 in a bid to save cash .
out of about 625,000 over 18s in the county , 6,000 have completed the survey .
dorset county council leader robert gould said he was confident it would be a `` representative sample '' .
the eight-week public consultation ends on 25 october .

documents.title: police patrols after cyclist 'dispute ' in gosport
text: police will be questioning members of the public one week on from an alleged dispute between a man and a cyclist in gosport .
roy galvin , 69 , from alverstoke died in hospital on wednesday - he was being treated for a head injury following an incident with another man on a bicycle on bury road .
officers will be in the area speaking to motorists and pedestrians on sunday afternoon .
a 28-year-old man from gosport initially charged with causing grievous bodily harm is now facing a charge of manslaughter .
he remains in custody and is due before portsmouth crown court on 31 october .

documents.title: travel : hold-ups in southampton
text: traffic light failure is causing delays in lodge road , southampton , at the a33 the avenue junction .
the a33 west quay road is also busy at the a3057 southern road junction because there are several cruise ships in port today .
for the latest , visit the bbc travel pages .

documents.title: weymouth double bus crash : police interview
text: insp matt butler , of dorset police 's traffic unit , said : .
`` one has driven into the back of another bus .
we 're working out exactly how the collision happened . ''
the force is appealing for witnesses to come forward .
dorset police

documents.title: investigation after buses crash launched
text: an investigation has begun into what caused two buses to crash into each other in weymouth .
the single-decker buses crashed on weymouth esplanade this morning .
five people were taken to dorset county hospital by ambulance - dorset police said their injuries were not `` life-threatening or life-changing '' .
seven people were taken to weymouth minor injuries unit for treatment .
a further six people sustained minor injuries and were treated at the scene .
first bus said : our thoughts are with those that were injured as a result of the incident . ''
we are working closely with the emergency services and have launched a full investigation to establish exactly what happened . ''
weymouth esplanade has now reopened .

documents.title: double bus crash recovery operation underway
text: a recovery operation is underway in weymouth after two buses crashed earlier this morning .
fourteen people suffered minor injuries in the crash on the esplanade .
the road remains closed .
buses from the kings statue are suspended and will divert or terminate short of their destination .
travel dorset
traveldorset
weymouth - the esplanade - vehicle recovery underway and we 'll be attending to the oil spill around king 's statue .
weymouth - the esplanade - vehicle recovery underway and we 'll be attending to the oil spill around king 's statue .

documents.title: buses crash in weymouth - latest
text: here are the latest from the crash involving two buses in weymouth .
the single-decker buses crashed on the esplanade just before 10:40 bst .
both buses were carrying passengers at the time of the crash , 14 suffered minor injuries .

documents.title: weymouth esplanade remains closed after buses crash
text: the esplanade in weymouth remains closed following a crash between two buses .
south western ambulance service said 14 people were hurt in the crash .
the service said 10 were treated at the scene with four taken to dorset county hospital .
their injuries are now reported to be `` minor '' and not as serious as first thought .
the crash happened shortly before 10:40 bst .

documents.title: police say 14 people hurt
text: picture from witness ian shows the aftermath of bus crash in weymouth on esplanade - police now say 14 hurt , all minor injuries

documents.title: 'serious injuries ' as two buses crash in weymouth
text: two people have been taken to hospital with `` serious injuries '' after two buses crashed in weymouth .
a local shopkeeper who saw the crash happen on the esplanade said `` the noise of the collision was incredibly loud and there 's now a lot of broken glass '' .
travel dorset
traveldorset
weymouth - the esplanade closed due to a collision , two buses involved : dorsetforyou.com/travel-dorset/
the road is closed between the jubilee clock tower and king 's statue .
dorset police said a number of other people are believed to have suffered minor injuries .
weymouth - the esplanade closed due to a collision , two buses involved :

documents.title: world war two bomb blown up in solent
text: a world war two bomb has been blown up in the sea off the isle of wight .
it was found by a dredging barge on the seabed in portsmouth harbour on thursday .
the 500kg ( 1,100lb ) device was towed by a navy bomb disposal team to a detonation site in the solent , where a controlled explosion was carried out .
dredging work is being carried out in portsmouth harbour to allow the the navy 's new 65,000-tonne aircraft carriers to dock .

documents.title: two 'seriously injured ' in bus crash
text: two people have suffered serious injuries in a crash involving two buses in weymouth .
the esplanade in weymouth has been closed following the crash which happened between two single-decker buses just before 10:40 bst .
a number of other passengers are believed to have suffered minor injuries .
the road has been closed while emergency services deal with the incident .
motorists are being advised to avoid the area .

documents.title: charges for dumping diy waste come in tomorrow
text: charges for materials classed as `` diy construction waste '' come in at waste recycling centres across hampshire from tomorrow .
the new fees are for materials including soil and plasterboard .
the payments , which come in tomorrow , range from £ 2.50 for a bag of soil , to £ 10 for a sheet of plasterboard .
a £ 2.50 charge will also be made for individual items including wash basins and toilets .

documents.title: man charged over pcso assault
text: a man has been charged with assaulting a police community support officer ( pcso ) in bournemouth after allegedly head-butting her .
the 42-year-old man , from the town , has been charged with with assaulting one pcso , racially-aggravated assault on a second pcso , assaulting a town centre ranger and theft , dorset police said .
the incident happened in the square following reports of a theft of a charity box from the natwest bank on 29 september .
he is due to appear before bournemouth magistrates ' court later .
dorset police
dorsetpolice
# latestnews man charged with assaulting psco dorset.police.uk/news-informati
# latestnews man charged with assaulting psco

documents.title: police investigate sus approach to boy
text: a report of a sus approach being made to a child in tadley , is being investigated by police .
hampshire constabulary said an 11-year-old boy walking along brimpton road was approached by an `` older woman '' in a blue vehicle who offered him a lift home .
the boy declined the lift .
police have asked for anyone with information about the incident to contact them .

documents.title: support sought for dorset marine conservation zones
text: the wildlife trusts have launched a campaign for the uk to declare many more marine conservation zones ( mczs ) to safeguard mammals round the shores .
dorset wildlife trust ( dwt ) have recommended several sites to be designated as marine conservation zones ( mcz 's ) including studland bay , south of portland and broadbench to kimmeridge .

dwt 's peter tinsley said : `` the government committed to creating a 'blue belt ' around the country , and these dorset sites are essential links in that belt , protecting the diverse natural landscapes that exist beneath the waves off our coast .
this is our last chance to make a big difference for marine wildlife . ''

documents.title: 'my life has been turned upside down '
text: a woman who set up a carers support group says her life has been turned `` upside down '' after she was injured in a collision with a car .
enid evans set up carers moving forward in dorchester for people who are looking after a loved one , to meet and share their experiences .
speaking on bbc breakfast in dorset , she said : `` it was a very hard decision but sometimes there is just no option it 's very sad . ''
that group has since been closed , as enid 's injuries have left her with limited mobility .
however , the bournemouth branch will continue to operate .

documents.title: travel : southampton traffic delay warning as cruise ships dock
text: delays are expected today on the a33 west quay road in southampton because there are three cruise ships in port .
celebrity eclipse , queen elizabeth and ventura are all due to sail at 16:30 bst .
check your journey with bbc travel .

documents.title: halfway mark for dorset councils merger plan
text: the public consultation into merging all nine dorset councils has reached halfway .
figures show more than 6,000 people have responded to online and household surveys about the plans .
it 's hoped the mergers would cut the number of councillors from 330 to 80 and save more than £ 100m over six years .
the consultation closes on 25 october .

documents.title: world war ii bomb to be blown up off isle of wight after 10:00
text: a large unexploded world war ii bomb found on the seabed in portsmouth harbour is expected to be blown up between 10:00 - 11:00 bst this morning .
the 500kg ( 1,100lb ) device has been towed out to sea off the isle of wight by a navy bomb disposal team .
it was found by a barge carrying out dredging works on thursday .

documents.title: saints ' black named in corruption claims
text: southampton assistant manager eric black has denied claims made by the daily telegraph newspaper that he gave undercover reporters advice on how to bribe officials at other clubs .
black was filmed apparently naming staff at other clubs who could be induced to pass on information about players to a company for cash .
such payments would be against football association rules .

documents.title: news headlines for the region
text: news headlines for the region

documents.title: controlled explosion for ww2 bomb
text: a world war ii bomb is due to be blown up in the sea off the isle of wight after it was found by a dredging barge on the seabed in portsmouth harbour .
the 500kg ( 1,100lb ) device was discovered on thursday .
it has been towed by a navy bomb disposal team to a detonation site in the solent , off the isle of wight where a controlled explosion is expected to be carried out .
following the find , the gunwharf quays retail complex had close early last night so the bomb could be moved off the seabed .

documents.title: weather : sunshine and scattered showers , some heavy
text: there 'll be sunny spells and scattered showers through the day for most of us , some briefly turning heavy , especially over higher ground such as the south downs .
showers may generally ease during the afternoon with more in the way of sunshine .
highs of 17c ( 63f )
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to local live for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can get in touch via email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
